txt.en: The dwarves who made their way to the Orc-watch from the Twenty-first Hall appear to have set discouraging traps for their enemies, but the traps are no longer working.\n\nIt would certainly be a boon to the dwarves defending the outpost in the Redhorn Lodes to have these traps be operational.
You have armed the traps meant to hinder the advance of the Ghâsh-hai in southern Zelem-melek.\n\nThough the dwarves know it not, you have rendered them a great service.
'If the Ghash-hai join up with the Mordor Orcs this soon, all of our work will be for naught, and the Enemy will control all of Khazad-dûm. Make haste!'
The dwarves who made their way to the Orc-watch from the Twenty-first Hall appear to have set discouraging traps for their enemies, but the traps are no longer working.

The traps are in the southern halls of Zelem-melek, to the west and north of the Orc-watch. The dwarves placed them near Gabil-mamach and Budkhul-tharâkh.\n\nYou should arm the traps that have stopped working to help make the passages safer against the enemies of Khazad-dûm.
You have armed the traps meant to hinder the advance of the Ghâsh-hai in southern Zelem-melek.\n\nThough the dwarves know it not, you have rendered them a great service.
